forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely before 4am. Mostly cloudy. Low around 43, with temperatures rising to around 45 overnight. East wind around 8 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely after 10am. Partly sunny. High near 55, with temperatures falling to around 53 in the afternoon. East northeast wind 1 to 12 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
The gentle nighttime rain blankets Downtown San Francisco, embodying the city's romantic moody essence. As the clock tiptoes past midnight, temperatures linger around the 43-degree mark, softly cradled by an eastward breeze. The skies overhead are draped in a veil of clouds, promising glimpses of softer light as dawn approaches. Yet, before the sun's embrace takes hold, scattered showers may linger, teasing you with the possibility of a brighter afternoon.

As Wednesday dawns, the transition from ink-black to twilight reveals a hint of promise. Expect rain later in the morning, although these droplets will play a tender background note to a reprise of sun and clouds amidst the cool coastal air. Dress in layers; a light jacket will fend off the chill, while comfortable shoes are advisable for a stroll through the city's vibrant streets. It may be an ideal day for winding through art-filled aisles of a local bookstore or savoring a warm cup from your favorite café, allowing the tender whispers of rain to accompany your thoughts. The day beckons with a balance of coolness and the thrill of sporadic sunshine, a perfect canvas for both indoor refuge and brisk exploration.
